item.title: The Philippines, ASEAN’s new chair, starts 2026 on a ‘weaker footing’ after trade tensions and a $2 billion corruption scandal
item.description: Third-quarter GDP growth in the Philippines fell to a four-year low of 4%, prompting Manila to slash growth targets for 2026 through 2028.

item.title: Elon Musk says humans are ‘pre-programmed to die’ and longevity is ‘solvable’, raising huge questions about the future of health
item.description: Musk once said he’d “prefer to be dead” than live to 100 with dementia or as a burden to society.

item.title: What Apple’s AI deal with Google means for the two tech giants, and for $500 billion ‘upstart’ OpenAI
item.description: The multi-year partnership validates Google's AI comeback, highlights Apple's AI struggles, and could spell trouble for OpenAI.

item.title: Carhartt CEO says they always focused on blue-collar workers—but hipsters came anyway: ‘We welcome anyone … that wants to celebrate hard work’
item.description: "We don't try to be everything to everybody," Carhartt CEO Linda Hubbard told Fortune, as she announced a blue-collar partnership with Ford Philanthro...

item.title: U.S workers just took home their smallest share of capital since 1947, at least
item.description: American workers aren’t just getting the smallest share of GDP since records began. Their share of employment is shrinking and shrinking
